Articles.Content:
1. Launch a bunch of debris into a 70 km orbit, make sure to mix the size of the debris, and make sure there's a lot of it all around the orbit (you should be constantly dodging debris, if you aren't it doesn't count), all near 0 orbital inclination.
  2. Launch a 1 Kerbal craft into a 70km 0 inclination Retrograde orbit.
  3. play 4 "games" (orbits) of frogger without hitting anything or re-entering the atmosphere.
  4. Post screenshots of your close calls.
  5. Closest call wins.

No. 4 will be hard. The relative velocity is around 4200m/s. Moreover, Even with hundreds of pieces of debris, it wouldn't be hard to avoid. It's actually pretty rare to get taken out by space junk. Not to mention, the game may not even register a collision because the relative speed is so high, one frame it's in front, next frame it's behind you. It wouldn't even notice.
you won't hit anything because the relative velocity is too high, even if you aim two large ships directly against each other you won't have a collision.
